div.head: John Douglass Will
div.p:
Charles County In the name of God Amen.
I John Douglass of Charles County in the province of Maryland
Gentleman being weake of body but of sound and perfect memory
praised be to God for the same doe make and ordaine this my
last will and testament in manner & so following that is to say
first I bequeathmy soule to God from whome I had it hoping one
day to make perfect through the pretious Death and passion of my
dear Saviour Jesus Christ and my body I commit to the earth from
where
where it came to be decently buried at the discression of my Executor hereafter
named.

Imp. It is my will that all my Just Debts and funeral charges be paid and
satisfied Item I give unto my loving son John Douglass five hundred
and fifty acres of land being part of a parcell of land containing one
thousand and fifty acreslaying at Potucent called Cole Spring Manner
when he shall arrive all the age of one and twenty years wth all the
priviledges belonging to that Lord of manner and to his heirs lawfully
to be gather of his body and for the want of such if use my will & pleasure is
that
